sections.title: Introduction
sections.content:
Table content:
Hardware | PCI/USB ID | Working?
Audio | 1022:15e3 | Yes
Bluetooth | 0489:e0fc | Yes
Fingerprint reader | 27c6:6594 | Yes
GPU | 1002:150e | Yes
Touchpad |  | Yes
TrackPoint |  | Yes
WWAN (5G) | 1eac:1007 | Yes
Webcam | 30c9:00cd | Yes
Wireless | 17cb:1107 | Yes

sections.title: Installation
sections.content: Wifi does not work during installation. A possible workaround is to connect a cable for example with an ethernet USB adapter. It works after installation with the linux-firmware package installed.

sections.title: Fan / Thermal management
sections.content:
The default thermal management leads to the fan almost always running (seems to be a common issue as also being mentioned in a review).

The good news is that the devices are supported by thinkfan, so this can be mitigated. See Fan speed control.

sections.title: WWAN
sections.content: This Thinkpad model seems to use the same WWAN modules as the Lenovo ThinkPad X1 Carbon (Gen 12). Following instructions on that wiki page works for the 5G module with identifier 1eac:1007.

sections.title: Accessibility
sections.content: The BIOS has a newer graphical user interface with pointer navigation. It is still readable and can be navigated with the keyboard. A user manual with explanations is available, see #See also.
